scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Tis hatch'd and shall be so: Tranio, at once

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Uncase thee; take my colour'd hat and cloak:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: When Biondello comes, he waits on thee;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: But I will charm him first to keep his tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: So had you need.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: In brief, sir, sith it your pleasure is,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And I am tied to be obedient;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: For so your father charged me at our parting,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Be serviceable to my son,' quoth he,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Although I think 'twas in another sense;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I am content to be Lucentio,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Because so well I love Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Tranio, be so, because Lucentio loves:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And let me be a slave, to achieve that maid

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Whose sudden sight hath thrall'd my wounded eye.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Here comes the rogue.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Sirrah, where have you been?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Where have I been! Nay, how now! where are you?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Master, has my fellow Tranio stolen your clothes? Or

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: you stolen his? or both? pray, what's the news?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Sirrah, come hither: 'tis no time to jest,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And therefore frame your manners to the time.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Your fellow Tranio here, to save my life,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Puts my apparel and my countenance on,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And I for my escape have put on his;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: For in a quarrel since I came ashore

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I kill'd a man and fear I was descried:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Wait you on him, I charge you, as becomes,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: While I make way from hence to save my life:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: You understand me?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I, sir! ne'er a whit.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And not a jot of Tranio in your mouth:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Tranio is changed into Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: The better for him: would I were so too!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: So could I, faith, boy, to have the next wish after,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That Lucentio indeed had Baptista's youngest daughter.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But, sirrah, not for my sake, but your master's, I advise

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: You use your manners discreetly in all kind of companies:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: When I am alone, why, then I am Tranio;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But in all places else your master Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Tranio, let's go: one thing more rests, that

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: thyself execute, to make one among these wooers: if

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: thou ask me why, sufficeth, my reasons are both good

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: and weighty.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: First Servant
line: My lord, you nod; you do not mind the play.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: SLY
line: Yes, by Saint Anne, do I. A good matter, surely:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: SLY
line: comes there any more of it?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: Page
line: My lord, 'tis but begun.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: SLY
line: 'Tis a very excellent piece of work, madam lady:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A public place.
speaker: SLY
line: would 'twere done!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Verona, for a while I take my leave,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To see my friends in Padua, but of all

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My best beloved and approved friend,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Hortensio; and I trow this is his house.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here, sirrah Grumio; knock, I say.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Knock, sir! whom should I knock? is there man has

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: rebused your worship?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Villain, I say, knock me here soundly.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Knock you here, sir! why, sir, what am I, sir, that

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I should knock you here, sir?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Villain, I say, knock me at this gate

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And rap me well, or I'll knock your knave's pate.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: My master is grown quarrelsome. I should knock

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: you first,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: And then I know after who comes by the worst.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Will it not be?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Faith, sirrah, an you'll not knock, I'll ring it;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll try how you can sol, fa, and sing it.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Help, masters, help! my master is mad.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, knock when I bid you, sirrah villain!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: How now! what's the matter? My old friend Grumio!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: and my good friend Petruchio! How do you all at Verona?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Signior Hortensio, come you to part the fray?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Con tutto il cuore, ben trovato,' may I say.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: 'Alla nostra casa ben venuto, molto honorato signor

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: mio Petruchio.' Rise, Grumio, rise: we will compound

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: this quarrel.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Nay, 'tis no matter, sir, what he 'leges in Latin.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: if this be not a lawful case for me to leave his

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: service, look you, sir, he bid me knock him and rap

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: him soundly, sir: well, was it fit for a servant to

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: use his master so, being perhaps, for aught I see,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: two and thirty, a pip out? Whom would to God I had

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: well knock'd at first, Then had not Grumio come by the worst.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A senseless villain! Good Hortensio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I bade the rascal knock upon your gate

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And could not get him for my heart to do it.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Knock at the gate! O heavens! Spake you not these

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: words plain, 'Sirrah, knock me here, rap me here,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: knock me well, and knock me soundly'? And come you

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: now with, 'knocking at the gate'?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sirrah, be gone, or talk not, I advise you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, patience; I am Grumio's pledge:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Why, this's a heavy chance 'twixt him and you,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Your ancient, trusty, pleasant servant Grumio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And tell me now, sweet friend, what happy gale

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Blows you to Padua here from old Verona?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Such wind as scatters young men through the world,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To seek their fortunes farther than at home

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where small experience grows. But in a few,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Signior Hortensio, thus it stands with me:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Antonio, my father, is deceased;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And I have thrust myself into this maze,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Haply to wive and thrive as best I may:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Crowns in my purse I have and goods at home,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And so am come abroad to see the world.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, shall I then come roundly to thee

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And wish thee to a shrewd ill-favour'd wife?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Thou'ldst thank me but a little for my counsel:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And yet I'll promise thee she shall be rich

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And very rich: but thou'rt too much my friend,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And I'll not wish thee to her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Signior Hortensio, 'twixt such friends as we

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Few words suffice; and therefore, if thou know

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: One rich enough to be Petruchio's wife,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As wealth is burden of my wooing dance,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Be she as foul as was Florentius' love,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As old as Sibyl and as curst and shrewd

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As Socrates' Xanthippe, or a worse,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She moves me not, or not removes, at least,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Affection's edge in me, were she as rough

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As are the swelling Adriatic seas:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I come to wive it wealthily in Padua;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If wealthily, then happily in Padua.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Nay, look you, sir, he tells you flatly what his

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: mind is: Why give him gold enough and marry him to

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: a puppet or an aglet-baby; or an old trot with ne'er

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: a tooth in her head, though she have as many diseases

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: as two and fifty horses: why, nothing comes amiss,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: so money comes withal.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, since we are stepp'd thus far in,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I will continue that I broach'd in jest.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I can, Petruchio, help thee to a wife

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: With wealth enough and young and beauteous,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Brought up as best becomes a gentlewoman:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Her only fault, and that is faults enough,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Is that she is intolerable curst

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And shrewd and froward, so beyond all measure

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That, were my state far worser than it is,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I would not wed her for a mine of gold.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Hortensio, peace! thou know'st not gold's effect:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Tell me her father's name and 'tis enough;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For I will board her, though she chide as loud

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As thunder when the clouds in autumn crack.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Her father is Baptista Minola,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: An affable and courteous gentleman:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Her name is Katharina Minola,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Renown'd in Padua for her scolding tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I know her father, though I know not her;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And he knew my deceased father well.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will not sleep, Hortensio, till I see her;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And therefore let me be thus bold with you

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To give you over at this first encounter,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Unless you will accompany me thither.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I pray you, sir, let him go while the humour lasts.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O' my word, an she knew him as well as I do, she

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: would think scolding would do little good upon him:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: she may perhaps call him half a score knaves or so:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: why, that's nothing; an he begin once, he'll rail in

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: his rope-tricks. I'll tell you what sir, an she

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: stand him but a little, he will throw a figure in

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: her face and so disfigure her with it that she

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: shall have no more eyes to see withal than a cat.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: You know him not, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Tarry, Petruchio, I must go with thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For in Baptista's keep my treasure is:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: He hath the jewel of my life in hold,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: His youngest daughter, beautiful Binaca,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And her withholds from me and other more,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Suitors to her and rivals in my love,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Supposing it a thing impossible,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For those defects I have before rehearsed,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That ever Katharina will be woo'd;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Therefore this order hath Baptista ta'en,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That none shall have access unto Bianca

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Till Katharina the curst have got a husband.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Katharina the curst!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: A title for a maid of all titles the worst.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Now shall my friend Petruchio do me grace,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And offer me disguised in sober robes

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To old Baptista as a schoolmaster

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Well seen in music, to instruct Bianca;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That so I may, by this device, at least

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Have leave and leisure to make love to her

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And unsuspected court her by herself.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Here's no knavery! See, to beguile the old folks,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: how the young folks lay their heads together!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Master, master, look about you: who goes there, ha?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Peace, Grumio! it is the rival of my love.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, stand by a while.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: A proper stripling and an amorous!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: O, very well; I have perused the note.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hark you, sir: I'll have them very fairly bound:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: All books of love, see that at any hand;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And see you read no other lectures to her:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: You understand me: over and beside

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Signior Baptista's liberality,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I'll mend it with a largess. Take your paper too,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And let me have them very well perfumed

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: For she is sweeter than perfume itself

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: To whom they go to. What will you read to her?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Whate'er I read to her, I'll plead for you

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: As for my patron, stand you so assured,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: As firmly as yourself were still in place:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Yea, and perhaps with more successful words

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Than you, unless you were a scholar, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: O this learning, what a thing it is!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O this woodcock, what an ass it is!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Peace, sirrah!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Grumio, mum! God save you, Signior Gremio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And you are well met, Signior Hortensio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Trow you whither I am going? To Baptista Minola.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I promised to inquire carefully

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: About a schoolmaster for the fair Bianca:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And by good fortune I have lighted well

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: On this young man, for learning and behavior

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Fit for her turn, well read in poetry

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And other books, good ones, I warrant ye.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: 'Tis well; and I have met a gentleman

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Hath promised me to help me to another,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: A fine musician to instruct our mistress;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: So shall I no whit be behind in duty

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To fair Bianca, so beloved of me.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Beloved of me; and that my deeds shall prove.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: And that his bags shall prove.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Gremio, 'tis now no time to vent our love:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Listen to me, and if you speak me fair,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I'll tell you news indifferent good for either.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Here is a gentleman whom by chance I met,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Upon agreement from us to his liking,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Will undertake to woo curst Katharina,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Yea, and to marry her, if her dowry please.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: So said, so done, is well.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hortensio, have you told him all her faults?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I know she is an irksome brawling scold:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If that be all, masters, I hear no harm.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: No, say'st me so, friend? What countryman?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Born in Verona, old Antonio's son:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My father dead, my fortune lives for me;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And I do hope good days and long to see.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: O sir, such a life, with such a wife, were strange!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But if you have a stomach, to't i' God's name:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: You shall have me assisting you in all.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But will you woo this wild-cat?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Will I live?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Will he woo her? ay, or I'll hang her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why came I hither but to that intent?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Think you a little din can daunt mine ears?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Have I not in my time heard lions roar?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Have I not heard the sea puff'd up with winds

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Rage like an angry boar chafed with sweat?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Have I not heard great ordnance in the field,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And heaven's artillery thunder in the skies?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Have I not in a pitched battle heard

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Loud 'larums, neighing steeds, and trumpets' clang?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And do you tell me of a woman's tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That gives not half so great a blow to hear

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As will a chestnut in a farmer's fire?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Tush, tush! fear boys with bugs.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: For he fears none.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hortensio, hark:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: This gentleman is happily arrived,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: My mind presumes, for his own good and ours.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I promised we would be contributors

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And bear his charging of wooing, whatsoe'er.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And so we will, provided that he win her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I would I were as sure of a good dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Gentlemen, God save you. If I may be bold,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Tell me, I beseech you, which is the readiest way

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To the house of Signior Baptista Minola?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: He that has the two fair daughters: is't he you mean?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Even he, Biondello.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hark you, sir; you mean not her to--

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Perhaps, him and her, sir: what have you to do?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Not her that chides, sir, at any hand, I pray.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I love no chiders, sir. Biondello, let's away.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Well begun, Tranio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sir, a word ere you go;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Are you a suitor to the maid you talk of, yea or no?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And if I be, sir, is it any offence?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: No; if without more words you will get you hence.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Why, sir, I pray, are not the streets as free

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: For me as for you?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But so is not she.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: For what reason, I beseech you?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: For this reason, if you'll know,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That she's the choice love of Signior Gremio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That she's the chosen of Signior Hortensio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Softly, my masters! if you be gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Do me this right; hear me with patience.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Baptista is a noble gentleman,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To whom my father is not all unknown;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And were his daughter fairer than she is,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: She may more suitors have and me for one.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Fair Leda's daughter had a thousand wooers;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Then well one more may fair Bianca have:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And so she shall; Lucentio shall make one,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Though Paris came in hope to speed alone.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: What! this gentleman will out-talk us all.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Sir, give him head: I know he'll prove a jade.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Hortensio, to what end are all these words?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sir, let me be so bold as ask you,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Did you yet ever see Baptista's daughter?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: No, sir; but hear I do that he hath two,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: The one as famous for a scolding tongue

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As is the other for beauteous modesty.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sir, sir, the first's for me; let her go by.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Yea, leave that labour to great Hercules;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And let it be more than Alcides' twelve.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sir, understand you this of me in sooth:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The youngest daughter whom you hearken for

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her father keeps from all access of suitors,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And will not promise her to any man

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Until the elder sister first be wed:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The younger then is free and not before.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: If it be so, sir, that you are the man

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Must stead us all and me amongst the rest,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And if you break the ice and do this feat,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Achieve the elder, set the younger free

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: For our access, whose hap shall be to have her

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Will not so graceless be to be ingrate.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sir, you say well and well you do conceive;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And since you do profess to be a suitor,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: You must, as we do, gratify this gentleman,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To whom we all rest generally beholding.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Sir, I shall not be slack: in sign whereof,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Please ye we may contrive this afternoon,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And quaff carouses to our mistress' health,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And do as adversaries do in law,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Strive mightily, but eat and drink as friends.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O excellent motion! Fellows, let's be gone.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: The motion's good indeed and be it so,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, I shall be your ben venuto.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Good sister, wrong me not, nor wrong yourself,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: To make a bondmaid and a slave of me;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: That I disdain: but for these other gawds,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Unbind my hands, I'll pull them off myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Yea, all my raiment, to my petticoat;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Or what you will command me will I do,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: So well I know my duty to my elders.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Of all thy suitors, here I charge thee, tell

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Whom thou lovest best: see thou dissemble not.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Believe me, sister, of all the men alive

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I never yet beheld that special face

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Which I could fancy more than any other.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Minion, thou liest. Is't not Hortensio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: If you affect him, sister, here I swear

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I'll plead for you myself, but you shall have

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: him.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: O then, belike, you fancy riches more:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: You will have Gremio to keep you fair.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Is it for him you do envy me so?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Nay then you jest, and now I well perceive

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: You have but jested with me all this while:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I prithee, sister Kate, untie my hands.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: If that be jest, then all the rest was so.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, how now, dame! whence grows this insolence?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Bianca, stand aside. Poor girl! she weeps.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Go ply thy needle; meddle not with her.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: For shame, thou helding of a devilish spirit,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why dost thou wrong her that did ne'er wrong thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: When did she cross thee with a bitter word?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Her silence flouts me, and I'll be revenged.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What, in my sight? Bianca, get thee in.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What, will you not suffer me? Nay, now I see

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: She is your treasure, she must have a husband;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I must dance bare-foot on her wedding day

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And for your love to her lead apes in hell.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Talk not to me: I will go sit and weep

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Till I can find occasion of revenge.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Was ever gentleman thus grieved as I?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But who comes here?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Good morrow, neighbour Baptista.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Good morrow, neighbour Gremio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: God save you, gentlemen!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And you, good sir! Pray, have you not a daughter

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Call'd Katharina, fair and virtuous?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I have a daughter, sir, called Katharina.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: You are too blunt: go to it orderly.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You wrong me, Signior Gremio: give me leave.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I am a gentleman of Verona, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That, hearing of her beauty and her wit,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her affability and bashful modesty,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her wondrous qualities and mild behavior,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Am bold to show myself a forward guest

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Within your house, to make mine eye the witness

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Of that report which I so oft have heard.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, for an entrance to my entertainment,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I do present you with a man of mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Cunning in music and the mathematics,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To instruct her fully in those sciences,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Whereof I know she is not ignorant:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Accept of him, or else you do me wrong:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: His name is Licio, born in Mantua.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: You're welcome, sir; and he, for your good sake.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But for my daughter Katharina, this I know,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: She is not for your turn, the more my grief.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I see you do not mean to part with her,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Or else you like not of my company.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Mistake me not; I speak but as I find.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Whence are you, sir? what may I call your name?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Petruchio is my name; Antonio's son,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A man well known throughout all Italy.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I know him well: you are welcome for his sake.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Saving your tale, Petruchio, I pray,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Let us, that are poor petitioners, speak too:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Baccare! you are marvellous forward.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, pardon me, Signior Gremio; I would fain be doing.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I doubt it not, sir; but you will curse your

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: wooing. Neighbour, this is a gift very grateful, I am

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: sure of it. To express the like kindness, myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: that have been more kindly beholding to you than

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: any, freely give unto you this young scholar,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: that hath been long studying at Rheims; as cunning

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: in Greek, Latin, and other languages, as the other

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: in music and mathematics: his name is Cambio; pray,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: accept his service.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: A thousand thanks, Signior Gremio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Welcome, good Cambio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But, gentle sir, methinks you walk like a stranger:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: may I be so bold to know the cause of your coming?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Pardon me, sir, the boldness is mine own,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That, being a stranger in this city here,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Do make myself a suitor to your daughter,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Unto Bianca, fair and virtuous.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Nor is your firm resolve unknown to me,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: In the preferment of the eldest sister.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: This liberty is all that I request,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That, upon knowledge of my parentage,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I may have welcome 'mongst the rest that woo

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And free access and favour as the rest:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And, toward the education of your daughters,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I here bestow a simple instrument,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And this small packet of Greek and Latin books:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: If you accept them, then their worth is great.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Lucentio is your name; of whence, I pray?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of Pisa, sir; son to Vincentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: A mighty man of Pisa; by report

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I know him well: you are very welcome, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Take you the lute, and you the set of books;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: You shall go see your pupils presently.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Holla, within!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Sirrah, lead these gentlemen

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: To my daughters; and tell them both,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: These are their tutors: bid them use them well.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: We will go walk a little in the orchard,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And then to dinner. You are passing welcome,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And so I pray you all to think yourselves.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Signior Baptista, my business asketh haste,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And every day I cannot come to woo.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You knew my father well, and in him me,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Left solely heir to all his lands and goods,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Which I have better'd rather than decreased:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Then tell me, if I get your daughter's love,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What dowry shall I have with her to wife?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: After my death the one half of my lands,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And in possession twenty thousand crowns.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, for that dowry, I'll assure her of

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her widowhood, be it that she survive me,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: In all my lands and leases whatsoever:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Let specialties be therefore drawn between us,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That covenants may be kept on either hand.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Ay, when the special thing is well obtain'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: That is, her love; for that is all in all.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, that is nothing: for I tell you, father,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I am as peremptory as she proud-minded;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And where two raging fires meet together

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: They do consume the thing that feeds their fury:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Though little fire grows great with little wind,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Yet extreme gusts will blow out fire and all:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: So I to her and so she yields to me;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For I am rough and woo not like a babe.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Well mayst thou woo, and happy be thy speed!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But be thou arm'd for some unhappy words.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Ay, to the proof; as mountains are for winds,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That shake not, though they blow perpetually.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: How now, my friend! why dost thou look so pale?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For fear, I promise you, if I look pale.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What, will my daughter prove a good musician?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I think she'll sooner prove a soldier

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Iron may hold with her, but never lutes.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, then thou canst not break her to the lute?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Why, no; for she hath broke the lute to me.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I did but tell her she mistook her frets,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And bow'd her hand to teach her fingering;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: When, with a most impatient devilish spirit,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: 'Frets, call you these?' quoth she; 'I'll fume

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: with them:'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And, with that word, she struck me on the head,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And through the instrument my pate made way;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And there I stood amazed for a while,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: As on a pillory, looking through the lute;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: While she did call me rascal fiddler

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And twangling Jack; with twenty such vile terms,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: As had she studied to misuse me so.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, by the world, it is a lusty wench;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I love her ten times more than e'er I did:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, how I long to have some chat with her!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Well, go with me and be not so discomfited:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Proceed in practise with my younger daughter;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: She's apt to learn and thankful for good turns.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Signior Petruchio, will you go with us,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Or shall I send my daughter Kate to you?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I pray you do.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will attend her here,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And woo her with some spirit when she comes.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Say that she rail; why then I'll tell her plain

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She sings as sweetly as a nightingale:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Say that she frown, I'll say she looks as clear

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As morning roses newly wash'd with dew:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Say she be mute and will not speak a word;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Then I'll commend her volubility,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And say she uttereth piercing eloquence:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If she do bid me pack, I'll give her thanks,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As though she bid me stay by her a week:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If she deny to wed, I'll crave the day

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: When I shall ask the banns and when be married.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But here she comes; and now, Petruchio, speak.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Good morrow, Kate; for that's your name, I hear.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Well have you heard, but something hard of hearing:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: They call me Katharina that do talk of me.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You lie, in faith; for you are call'd plain Kate,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And bonny Kate and sometimes Kate the curst;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But Kate, the prettiest Kate in Christendom

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Kate of Kate Hall, my super-dainty Kate,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For dainties are all Kates, and therefore, Kate,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Take this of me, Kate of my consolation;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Hearing thy mildness praised in every town,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thy virtues spoke of, and thy beauty sounded,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Yet not so deeply as to thee belongs,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Myself am moved to woo thee for my wife.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Moved! in good time: let him that moved you hither

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Remove you hence: I knew you at the first

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: You were a moveable.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, what's a moveable?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A join'd-stool.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thou hast hit it: come, sit on me.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Asses are made to bear, and so are you.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Women are made to bear, and so are you.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: No such jade as you, if me you mean.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Alas! good Kate, I will not burden thee;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For, knowing thee to be but young and light--

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Too light for such a swain as you to catch;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And yet as heavy as my weight should be.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Should be! should--buzz!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Well ta'en, and like a buzzard.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O slow-wing'd turtle! shall a buzzard take thee?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Ay, for a turtle, as he takes a buzzard.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, come, you wasp; i' faith, you are too angry.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: If I be waspish, best beware my sting.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My remedy is then, to pluck it out.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Ay, if the fool could find it where it lies,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Who knows not where a wasp does

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: wear his sting? In his tail.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: In his tongue.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Whose tongue?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Yours, if you talk of tails: and so farewell.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, with my tongue in your tail? nay, come again,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Good Kate; I am a gentleman.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That I'll try.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I swear I'll cuff you, if you strike again.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: So may you lose your arms:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: If you strike me, you are no gentleman;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And if no gentleman, why then no arms.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A herald, Kate? O, put me in thy books!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What is your crest? a coxcomb?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A combless cock, so Kate will be my hen.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: No cock of mine; you crow too like a craven.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, come, Kate, come; you must not look so sour.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: It is my fashion, when I see a crab.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, here's no crab; and therefore look not sour.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: There is, there is.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Then show it me.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Had I a glass, I would.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, you mean my face?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Well aim'd of such a young one.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, by Saint George, I am too young for you.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Yet you are wither'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Tis with cares.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I care not.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, hear you, Kate: in sooth you scape not so.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I chafe you, if I tarry: let me go.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: No, not a whit: I find you passing gentle.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Twas told me you were rough and coy and sullen,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And now I find report a very liar;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For thou are pleasant, gamesome, passing courteous,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But slow in speech, yet sweet as spring-time flowers:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thou canst not frown, thou canst not look askance,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nor bite the lip, as angry wenches will,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nor hast thou pleasure to be cross in talk,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But thou with mildness entertain'st thy wooers,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: With gentle conference, soft and affable.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why does the world report that Kate doth limp?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O slanderous world! Kate like the hazel-twig

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Is straight and slender and as brown in hue

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As hazel nuts and sweeter than the kernels.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, let me see thee walk: thou dost not halt.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Go, fool, and whom thou keep'st command.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Did ever Dian so become a grove

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As Kate this chamber with her princely gait?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, be thou Dian, and let her be Kate;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And then let Kate be chaste and Dian sportful!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Where did you study all this goodly speech?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It is extempore, from my mother-wit.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A witty mother! witless else her son.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Am I not wise?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Yes; keep you warm.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Marry, so I mean, sweet Katharina, in thy bed:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And therefore, setting all this chat aside,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thus in plain terms: your father hath consented

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That you shall be my wife; your dowry 'greed on;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, Will you, nill you, I will marry you.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, Kate, I am a husband for your turn;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For, by this light, whereby I see thy beauty,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thy beauty, that doth make me like thee well,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thou must be married to no man but me;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For I am he am born to tame you Kate,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And bring you from a wild Kate to a Kate

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Conformable as other household Kates.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here comes your father: never make denial;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I must and will have Katharina to my wife.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now, Signior Petruchio, how speed you with my daughter?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How but well, sir? how but well?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It were impossible I should speed amiss.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, how now, daughter Katharina! in your dumps?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Call you me daughter? now, I promise you

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: You have show'd a tender fatherly regard,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To wish me wed to one half lunatic;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A mad-cup ruffian and a swearing Jack,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That thinks with oaths to face the matter out.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Father, 'tis thus: yourself and all the world,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That talk'd of her, have talk'd amiss of her:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If she be curst, it is for policy,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For she's not froward, but modest as the dove;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She is not hot, but temperate as the morn;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For patience she will prove a second Grissel,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And Roman Lucrece for her chastity:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And to conclude, we have 'greed so well together,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That upon Sunday is the wedding-day.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I'll see thee hang'd on Sunday first.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hark, Petruchio; she says she'll see thee

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: hang'd first.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Is this your speeding? nay, then, good night our part!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Be patient, gentlemen; I choose her for myself:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: If she and I be pleased, what's that to you?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Tis bargain'd 'twixt us twain, being alone,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That she shall still be curst in company.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I tell you, 'tis incredible to believe

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How much she loves me: O, the kindest Kate!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She hung about my neck; and kiss on kiss

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She vied so fast, protesting oath on oath,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That in a twink she won me to her love.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, you are novices! 'tis a world to see,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How tame, when men and women are alone,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A meacock wretch can make the curstest shrew.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Give me thy hand, Kate: I will unto Venice,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To buy apparel 'gainst the wedding-day.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Provide the feast, father, and bid the guests;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will be sure my Katharina shall be fine.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I know not what to say: but give me your hands;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: God send you joy, Petruchio! 'tis a match.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Amen, say we: we will be witnesses.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Father, and wife, and gentlemen, adieu;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will to Venice; Sunday comes apace:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: We will have rings and things and fine array;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And kiss me, Kate, we will be married o'Sunday.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Was ever match clapp'd up so suddenly?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Faith, gentlemen, now I play a merchant's part,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And venture madly on a desperate mart.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Twas a commodity lay fretting by you:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Twill bring you gain, or perish on the seas.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: The gain I seek is, quiet in the match.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: No doubt but he hath got a quiet catch.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But now, Baptists, to your younger daughter:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Now is the day we long have looked for:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I am your neighbour, and was suitor first.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And I am one that love Bianca more

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Than words can witness, or your thoughts can guess.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Youngling, thou canst not love so dear as I.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Graybeard, thy love doth freeze.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But thine doth fry.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Skipper, stand back: 'tis age that nourisheth.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But youth in ladies' eyes that flourisheth.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Content you, gentlemen: I will compound this strife:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: 'Tis deeds must win the prize; and he of both

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: That can assure my daughter greatest dower

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
