line: Shall have my Bianca's love.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Say, Signior Gremio, What can you assure her?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: First, as you know, my house within the city

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Is richly furnished with plate and gold;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Basins and ewers to lave her dainty hands;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: My hangings all of Tyrian tapestry;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: In ivory coffers I have stuff'd my crowns;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: In cypress chests my arras counterpoints,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Costly apparel, tents, and canopies,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Fine linen, Turkey cushions boss'd with pearl,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Valance of Venice gold in needlework,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Pewter and brass and all things that belong

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: To house or housekeeping: then, at my farm

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I have a hundred milch-kine to the pail,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Sixscore fat oxen standing in my stalls,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And all things answerable to this portion.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Myself am struck in years, I must confess;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And if I die to-morrow, this is hers,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: If whilst I live she will be only mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That 'only' came well in. Sir, list to me:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I am my father's heir and only son:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: If I may have your daughter to my wife,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I'll leave her houses three or four as good,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Within rich Pisa walls, as any one

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Old Signior Gremio has in Padua;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Besides two thousand ducats by the year

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of fruitful land, all which shall be her jointure.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: What, have I pinch'd you, Signior Gremio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Two thousand ducats by the year of land!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: My land amounts not to so much in all:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That she shall have; besides an argosy

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That now is lying in Marseilles' road.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: What, have I choked you with an argosy?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Gremio, 'tis known my father hath no less

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Than three great argosies; besides two galliases,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And twelve tight galleys: these I will assure her,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And twice as much, whate'er thou offer'st next.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Nay, I have offer'd all, I have no more;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And she can have no more than all I have:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: If you like me, she shall have me and mine.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Why, then the maid is mine from all the world,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: By your firm promise: Gremio is out-vied.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I must confess your offer is the best;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And, let your father make her the assurance,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: She is your own; else, you must pardon me,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: if you should die before him, where's her dower?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That's but a cavil: he is old, I young.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And may not young men die, as well as old?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Well, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I am thus resolved: on Sunday next you know

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: My daughter Katharina is to be married:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now, on the Sunday following, shall Bianca

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Be bride to you, if you this assurance;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: If not, Signior Gremio:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And so, I take my leave, and thank you both.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Adieu, good neighbour.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Now I fear thee not:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Sirrah young gamester, your father were a fool

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: To give thee all, and in his waning age

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Set foot under thy table: tut, a toy!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: An old Italian fox is not so kind, my boy.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: A vengeance on your crafty wither'd hide!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Yet I have faced it with a card of ten.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis in my head to do my master good:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I see no reason but supposed Lucentio

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Must get a father, call'd 'supposed Vincentio;'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And that's a wonder: fathers commonly

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Do get their children; but in this case of wooing,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: A child shall get a sire, if I fail not of my cunning.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Fiddler, forbear; you grow too forward, sir:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Have you so soon forgot the entertainment

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Her sister Katharina welcomed you withal?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: But, wrangling pedant, this is

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: The patroness of heavenly harmony:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Then give me leave to have prerogative;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And when in music we have spent an hour,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Your lecture shall have leisure for as much.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Preposterous ass, that never read so far

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: To know the cause why music was ordain'd!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Was it not to refresh the mind of man

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: After his studies or his usual pain?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Then give me leave to read philosophy,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And while I pause, serve in your harmony.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sirrah, I will not bear these braves of thine.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Why, gentlemen, you do me double wrong,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: To strive for that which resteth in my choice:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I am no breeching scholar in the schools;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I'll not be tied to hours nor 'pointed times,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: But learn my lessons as I please myself.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: And, to cut off all strife, here sit we down:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Take you your instrument, play you the whiles;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: His lecture will be done ere you have tuned.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: You'll leave his lecture when I am in tune?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: That will be never: tune your instrument.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Where left we last?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Here, madam:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Hic ibat Simois; hic est Sigeia tellus;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Hic steterat Priami regia celsa senis.'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Construe them.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Hic ibat,' as I told you before, 'Simois,' I am

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Lucentio, 'hic est,' son unto Vincentio of Pisa,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Sigeia tellus,' disguised thus to get your love;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Hic steterat,' and that Lucentio that comes

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: a-wooing, 'Priami,' is my man Tranio, 'regia,'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: bearing my port, 'celsa senis,' that we might

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: beguile the old pantaloon.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Madam, my instrument's in tune.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Let's hear. O fie! the treble jars.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Spit in the hole, man, and tune again.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Now let me see if I can construe it: 'Hic ibat

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Simois,' I know you not, 'hic est Sigeia tellus,' I

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: trust you not; 'Hic steterat Priami,' take heed

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: he hear us not, 'regia,' presume not, 'celsa senis,'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: despair not.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Madam, 'tis now in tune.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: All but the base.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: The base is right; 'tis the base knave that jars.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: How fiery and forward our pedant is!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Now, for my life, the knave doth court my love:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Pedascule, I'll watch you better yet.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: In time I may believe, yet I mistrust.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Mistrust it not: for, sure, AEacides

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Was Ajax, call'd so from his grandfather.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I must believe my master; else, I promise you,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: I should be arguing still upon that doubt:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: But let it rest. Now, Licio, to you:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Good masters, take it not unkindly, pray,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: That I have been thus pleasant with you both.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: You may go walk, and give me leave a while:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: My lessons make no music in three parts.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Are you so formal, sir? well, I must wait,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And watch withal; for, but I be deceived,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Our fine musician groweth amorous.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Madam, before you touch the instrument,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To learn the order of my fingering,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I must begin with rudiments of art;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To teach you gamut in a briefer sort,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: More pleasant, pithy and effectual,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Than hath been taught by any of my trade:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And there it is in writing, fairly drawn.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Why, I am past my gamut long ago.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Yet read the gamut of Hortensio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Reads  ''Gamut' I am, the ground of all accord,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: 'A re,' to Plead Hortensio's passion;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: 'B mi,' Bianca, take him for thy lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: 'C fa ut,' that loves with all affection:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: 'D sol re,' one clef, two notes have I:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: 'E la mi,' show pity, or I die.'

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Call you this gamut? tut, I like it not:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Old fashions please me best; I am not so nice,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: To change true rules for old inventions.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: Mistress, your father prays you leave your books

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: And help to dress your sister's chamber up:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Servant
line: You know to-morrow is the wedding-day.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Farewell, sweet masters both; I must be gone.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Faith, mistress, then I have no cause to stay.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: But I have cause to pry into this pedant:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Methinks he looks as though he were in love:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Yet if thy thoughts, Bianca, be so humble

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To cast thy wandering eyes on every stale,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Seize thee that list: if once I find thee ranging,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Hortensio will be quit with thee by changing.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: To TRANIO  Signior Lucentio, this is the

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: 'pointed day.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: That Katharina and Petruchio should be married,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And yet we hear not of our son-in-law.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What will be said? what mockery will it be,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: To want the bridegroom when the priest attends

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: To speak the ceremonial rites of marriage!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What says Lucentio to this shame of ours?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: No shame but mine: I must, forsooth, be forced

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To give my hand opposed against my heart

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Unto a mad-brain rudesby full of spleen;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Who woo'd in haste and means to wed at leisure.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I told you, I, he was a frantic fool,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Hiding his bitter jests in blunt behavior:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And, to be noted for a merry man,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: He'll woo a thousand, 'point the day of marriage,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Make feasts, invite friends, and proclaim the banns;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Yet never means to wed where he hath woo'd.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Now must the world point at poor Katharina,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And say, 'Lo, there is mad Petruchio's wife,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: If it would please him come and marry her!'

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Patience, good Katharina, and Baptista too.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Upon my life, Petruchio means but well,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Whatever fortune stays him from his word:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Though he be blunt, I know him passing wise;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Though he be merry, yet withal he's honest.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Would Katharina had never seen him though!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Go, girl; I cannot blame thee now to weep;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: For such an injury would vex a very saint,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Much more a shrew of thy impatient humour.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Master, master! news, old news, and such news as

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: you never heard of!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Is it new and old too? how may that be?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Why, is it not news, to hear of Petruchio's coming?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Is he come?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Why, no, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What then?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: He is coming.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: When will he be here?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: When he stands where I am and sees you there.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But say, what to thine old news?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Why, Petruchio is coming in a new hat and an old

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: jerkin, a pair of old breeches thrice turned, a pair

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: of boots that have been candle-cases, one buckled,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: another laced, an old rusty sword ta'en out of the

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: town-armory, with a broken hilt, and chapeless;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: with two broken points: his horse hipped with an

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: old mothy saddle and stirrups of no kindred;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: besides, possessed with the glanders and like to mose

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: in the chine; troubled with the lampass, infected

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: with the fashions, full of wingdalls, sped with

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: spavins, rayed with yellows, past cure of the fives,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: stark spoiled with the staggers, begnawn with the

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: bots, swayed in the back and shoulder-shotten;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: near-legged before and with, a half-chequed bit

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: and a head-stall of sheeps leather which, being

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: restrained to keep him from stumbling, hath been

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: often burst and now repaired with knots; one girth

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: six time pieced and a woman's crupper of velure,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: which hath two letters for her name fairly set down

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: in studs, and here and there pieced with packthread.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Who comes with him?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: O, sir, his lackey, for all the world caparisoned

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: like the horse; with a linen stock on one leg and a

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: kersey boot-hose on the other, gartered with a red

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: and blue list; an old hat and 'the humour of forty

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: fancies' pricked in't for a feather: a monster, a

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: very monster in apparel, and not like a Christian

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: footboy or a gentleman's lackey.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis some odd humour pricks him to this fashion;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Yet oftentimes he goes but mean-apparell'd.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I am glad he's come, howsoe'er he comes.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Why, sir, he comes not.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Didst thou not say he comes?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Who? that Petruchio came?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Ay, that Petruchio came.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: No, sir, I say his horse comes, with him on his back.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, that's all one.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Nay, by Saint Jamy,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I hold you a penny,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: A horse and a man

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Is more than one,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: And yet not many.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, where be these gallants? who's at home?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: You are welcome, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And yet I come not well.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And yet you halt not.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Not so well apparell'd

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As I wish you were.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Were it better, I should rush in thus.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But where is Kate? where is my lovely bride?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How does my father? Gentles, methinks you frown:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And wherefore gaze this goodly company,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As if they saw some wondrous monument,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Some comet or unusual prodigy?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, sir, you know this is your wedding-day:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: First were we sad, fearing you would not come;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now sadder, that you come so unprovided.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Fie, doff this habit, shame to your estate,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: An eye-sore to our solemn festival!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And tells us, what occasion of import

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Hath all so long detain'd you from your wife,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And sent you hither so unlike yourself?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Tedious it were to tell, and harsh to hear:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sufficeth I am come to keep my word,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Though in some part enforced to digress;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Which, at more leisure, I will so excuse

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As you shall well be satisfied withal.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But where is Kate? I stay too long from her:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The morning wears, 'tis time we were at church.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: See not your bride in these unreverent robes:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Go to my chamber; Put on clothes of mine.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Not I, believe me: thus I'll visit her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But thus, I trust, you will not marry her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Good sooth, even thus; therefore ha' done with words:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To me she's married, not unto my clothes:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Could I repair what she will wear in me,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As I can change these poor accoutrements,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Twere well for Kate and better for myself.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But what a fool am I to chat with you,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: When I should bid good morrow to my bride,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And seal the title with a lovely kiss!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: He hath some meaning in his mad attire:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: We will persuade him, be it possible,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To put on better ere he go to church.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I'll after him, and see the event of this.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But to her love concerneth us to add

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Her father's liking: which to bring to pass,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As I before unparted to your worship,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I am to get a man,--whate'er he be,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: It skills not much. we'll fit him to our turn,--

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And he shall be Vincentio of Pisa;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And make assurance here in Padua

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of greater sums than I have promised.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: So shall you quietly enjoy your hope,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And marry sweet Bianca with consent.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Were it not that my fellow-school-master

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Doth watch Bianca's steps so narrowly,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Twere good, methinks, to steal our marriage;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Which once perform'd, let all the world say no,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I'll keep mine own, despite of all the world.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That by degrees we mean to look into,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And watch our vantage in this business:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: We'll over-reach the greybeard, Gremio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: The narrow-prying father, Minola,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: The quaint musician, amorous Licio;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: All for my master's sake, Lucentio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Signior Gremio, came you from the church?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: As willingly as e'er I came from school.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And is the bride and bridegroom coming home?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: A bridegroom say you? 'tis a groom indeed,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: A grumbling groom, and that the girl shall find.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Curster than she? why, 'tis impossible.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Why he's a devil, a devil, a very fiend.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Why, she's a devil, a devil, the devil's dam.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Tut, she's a lamb, a dove, a fool to him!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I'll tell you, Sir Lucentio: when the priest

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Should ask, if Katharina should be his wife,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: 'Ay, by gogs-wouns,' quoth he; and swore so loud,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That, all-amazed, the priest let fall the book;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And, as he stoop'd again to take it up,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: The mad-brain'd bridegroom took him such a cuff

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That down fell priest and book and book and priest:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: 'Now take them up,' quoth he, 'if any list.'

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: What said the wench when he rose again?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Trembled and shook; for why, he stamp'd and swore,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: As if the vicar meant to cozen him.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But after many ceremonies done,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: He calls for wine: 'A health!' quoth he, as if

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: He had been aboard, carousing to his mates

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: After a storm; quaff'd off the muscadel

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And threw the sops all in the sexton's face;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Having no other reason

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: But that his beard grew thin and hungerly

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And seem'd to ask him sops as he was drinking.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: This done, he took the bride about the neck

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And kiss'd her lips with such a clamorous smack

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: That at the parting all the church did echo:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And I seeing this came thence for very shame;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: And after me, I know, the rout is coming.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Such a mad marriage never was before:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Hark, hark! I hear the minstrels play.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Gentlemen and friends, I thank you for your pains:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I know you think to dine with me to-day,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And have prepared great store of wedding cheer;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But so it is, my haste doth call me hence,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And therefore here I mean to take my leave.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Is't possible you will away to-night?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I must away to-day, before night come:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Make it no wonder; if you knew my business,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You would entreat me rather go than stay.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, honest company, I thank you all,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That have beheld me give away myself

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To this most patient, sweet and virtuous wife:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Dine with my father, drink a health to me;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For I must hence; and farewell to you all.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Let us entreat you stay till after dinner.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It may not be.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Let me entreat you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It cannot be.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Let me entreat you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I am content.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Are you content to stay?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I am content you shall entreat me stay;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But yet not stay, entreat me how you can.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Now, if you love me, stay.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Grumio, my horse.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Ay, sir, they be ready: the oats have eaten the horses.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Nay, then,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Do what thou canst, I will not go to-day;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: No, nor to-morrow, not till I please myself.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: The door is open, sir; there lies your way;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: You may be jogging whiles your boots are green;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: For me, I'll not be gone till I please myself:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: 'Tis like you'll prove a jolly surly groom,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That take it on you at the first so roundly.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O Kate, content thee; prithee, be not angry.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I will be angry: what hast thou to do?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Father, be quiet; he shall stay my leisure.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Ay, marry, sir, now it begins to work.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATARINA
line: Gentlemen, forward to the bridal dinner:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATARINA
line: I see a woman may be made a fool,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: KATARINA
line: If she had not a spirit to resist.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: They shall go forward, Kate, at thy command.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Obey the bride, you that attend on her;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go to the feast, revel and domineer,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Carouse full measure to her maidenhead,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Be mad and merry, or go hang yourselves:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But for my bonny Kate, she must with me.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, look not big, nor stamp, nor stare, nor fret;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will be master of what is mine own:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She is my goods, my chattels; she is my house,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My household stuff, my field, my barn,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My horse, my ox, my ass, my any thing;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And here she stands, touch her whoever dare;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll bring mine action on the proudest he

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That stops my way in Padua. Grumio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Draw forth thy weapon, we are beset with thieves;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Rescue thy mistress, if thou be a man.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Fear not, sweet wench, they shall not touch

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: thee, Kate:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll buckler thee against a million.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Nay, let them go, a couple of quiet ones.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Went they not quickly, I should die with laughing.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of all mad matches never was the like.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Mistress, what's your opinion of your sister?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: That, being mad herself, she's madly mated.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I warrant him, Petruchio is Kated.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Neighbours and friends, though bride and

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: bridegroom wants

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: For to supply the places at the table,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: You know there wants no junkets at the feast.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Lucentio, you shall supply the bridegroom's place:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And let Bianca take her sister's room.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Shall sweet Bianca practise how to bride it?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: She shall, Lucentio. Come, gentlemen, let's go.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Fie, fie on all tired jades, on all mad masters, and

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: all foul ways! Was ever man so beaten? was ever

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: man so rayed? was ever man so weary? I am sent

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: before to make a fire, and they are coming after to

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: warm them. Now, were not I a little pot and soon

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: hot, my very lips might freeze to my teeth, my

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: tongue to the roof of my mouth, my heart in my

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: belly, ere I should come by a fire to thaw me: but

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I, with blowing the fire, shall warm myself; for,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: considering the weather, a taller man than I will

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: take cold. Holla, ho! Curtis.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Who is that calls so coldly?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: A piece of ice: if thou doubt it, thou mayst slide

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: from my shoulder to my heel with no greater a run

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: but my head and my neck. A fire good Curtis.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Is my master and his wife coming, Grumio?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O, ay, Curtis, ay: and therefore fire, fire; cast

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: on no water.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Is she so hot a shrew as she's reported?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: She was, good Curtis, before this frost: but, thou

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: knowest, winter tames man, woman and beast; for it

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: hath tamed my old master and my new mistress and

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: myself, fellow Curtis.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Away, you three-inch fool! I am no beast.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Am I but three inches? why, thy horn is a foot; and

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: so long am I at the least. But wilt thou make a

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: fire, or shall I complain on thee to our mistress,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: whose hand, she being now at hand, thou shalt soon

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: feel, to thy cold comfort, for being slow in thy hot office?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: I prithee, good Grumio, tell me, how goes the world?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: A cold world, Curtis, in every office but thine; and

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: therefore fire: do thy duty, and have thy duty; for

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: my master and mistress are almost frozen to death.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: There's fire ready; and therefore, good Grumio, the news.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Why, 'Jack, boy! ho! boy!' and as much news as

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: will thaw.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Come, you are so full of cony-catching!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Why, therefore fire; for I have caught extreme cold.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Where's the cook? is supper ready, the house

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: trimmed, rushes strewed, cobwebs swept; the

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: serving-men in their new fustian, their white

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: stockings, and every officer his wedding-garment on?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Be the jacks fair within, the jills fair without,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: the carpets laid, and every thing in order?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: All ready; and therefore, I pray thee, news.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: First, know, my horse is tired; my master and

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: mistress fallen out.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: How?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Out of their saddles into the dirt; and thereby

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: hangs a tale.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Let's ha't, good Grumio.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Lend thine ear.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Here.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: There.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: This is to feel a tale, not to hear a tale.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: And therefore 'tis called a sensible tale: and this

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: cuff was but to knock at your ear, and beseech

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: listening. Now I begin: Imprimis, we came down a

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: foul hill, my master riding behind my mistress,--

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Both of one horse?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: What's that to thee?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Why, a horse.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Tell thou the tale: but hadst thou not crossed me,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: thou shouldst have heard how her horse fell and she

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: under her horse; thou shouldst have heard in how

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: miry a place, how she was bemoiled, how he left her

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: with the horse upon her, how he beat me because

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: her horse stumbled, how she waded through the dirt

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: to pluck him off me, how he swore, how she prayed,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: that never prayed before, how I cried, how the

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: horses ran away, how her bridle was burst, how I

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: lost my crupper, with many things of worthy memory,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: which now shall die in oblivion and thou return

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: unexperienced to thy grave.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: By this reckoning he is more shrew than she.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Ay; and that thou and the proudest of you all shall

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: find when he comes home. But what talk I of this?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Call forth Nathaniel, Joseph, Nicholas, Philip,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Walter, Sugarsop and the rest: let their heads be

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: sleekly combed their blue coats brushed and their

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: garters of an indifferent knit: let them curtsy

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: with their left legs and not presume to touch a hair

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: of my master's horse-tail till they kiss their

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: hands. Are they all ready?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: They are.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Call them forth.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Do you hear, ho? you must meet my master to

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: countenance my mistress.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Why, she hath a face of her own.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Who knows not that?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Thou, it seems, that calls for company to

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: countenance her.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: I call them forth to credit her.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Why, she comes to borrow nothing of them.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: NATHANIEL
line: Welcome home, Grumio!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PHILIP
line: How now, Grumio!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: JOSEPH
line: What, Grumio!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: NICHOLAS
line: Fellow Grumio!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: NATHANIEL
line: How now, old lad?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Welcome, you;--how now, you;-- what, you;--fellow,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: you;--and thus much for greeting. Now, my spruce

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: companions, is all ready, and all things neat?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: NATHANIEL
line: All things is ready. How near is our master?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: E'en at hand, alighted by this; and therefore be

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: not--Cock's passion, silence! I hear my master.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where be these knaves? What, no man at door

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To hold my stirrup nor to take my horse!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where is Nathaniel, Gregory, Philip?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: ALL SERVING-MEN
line: Here, here, sir; here, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here, sir! here, sir! here, sir! here, sir!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You logger-headed and unpolish'd grooms!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, no attendance? no regard? no duty?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where is the foolish knave I sent before?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Here, sir; as foolish as I was before.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You peasant swain! you whoreson malt-horse drudge!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Did I not bid thee meet me in the park,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And bring along these rascal knaves with thee?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Nathaniel's coat, sir, was not fully made,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: And Gabriel's pumps were all unpink'd i' the heel;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: There was no link to colour Peter's hat,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: And Walter's dagger was not come from sheathing:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: There were none fine but Adam, Ralph, and Gregory;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: The rest were ragged, old, and beggarly;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Yet, as they are, here are they come to meet you.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go, rascals, go, and fetch my supper in.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where is the life that late I led--

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where are those--Sit down, Kate, and welcome.--

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sound, sound, sound, sound!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, when, I say? Nay, good sweet Kate, be merry.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Off with my boots, you rogues! you villains, when?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It was the friar of orders grey,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As he forth walked on his way:--

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Out, you rogue! you pluck my foot awry:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Take that, and mend the plucking off the other.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Be merry, Kate. Some water, here; what, ho!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where's my spaniel Troilus? Sirrah, get you hence,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And bid my cousin Ferdinand come hither:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: One, Kate, that you must kiss, and be acquainted with.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where are my slippers? Shall I have some water?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, Kate, and wash, and welcome heartily.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You whoreson villain! will you let it fall?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Patience, I pray you; 'twas a fault unwilling.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A whoreson beetle-headed, flap-ear'd knave!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, Kate, sit down; I know you have a stomach.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Will you give thanks, sweet Kate; or else shall I?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What's this? mutton?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: First Servant
line: Ay.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Who brought it?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETER
line: I.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Tis burnt; and so is all the meat.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What dogs are these! Where is the rascal cook?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How durst you, villains, bring it from the dresser,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And serve it thus to me that love it not?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Theretake it to you, trenchers, cups, and all;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You heedless joltheads and unmanner'd slaves!

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, do you grumble? I'll be with you straight.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I pray you, husband, be not so disquiet:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: The meat was well, if you were so contented.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I tell thee, Kate, 'twas burnt and dried away;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And I expressly am forbid to touch it,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For it engenders choler, planteth anger;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And better 'twere that both of us did fast,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Since, of ourselves, ourselves are choleric,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Than feed it with such over-roasted flesh.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Be patient; to-morrow 't shall be mended,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, for this night, we'll fast for company:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, I will bring thee to thy bridal chamber.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: NATHANIEL
line: Peter, didst ever see the like?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETER
line: He kills her in her own humour.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Where is he?

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: In her chamber, making a sermon of continency to her;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: And rails, and swears, and rates, that she, poor soul,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Knows not which way to stand, to look, to speak,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: And sits as one new-risen from a dream.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: CURTIS
line: Away, away! for he is coming hither.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thus have I politicly begun my reign,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And 'tis my hope to end successfully.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My falcon now is sharp and passing empty;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And till she stoop she must not be full-gorged,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For then she never looks upon her lure.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Another way I have to man my haggard,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To make her come and know her keeper's call,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That is, to watch her, as we watch these kites

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That bate and beat and will not be obedient.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She eat no meat to-day, nor none shall eat;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Last night she slept not, nor to-night she shall not;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As with the meat, some undeserved fault

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll find about the making of the bed;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And here I'll fling the pillow, there the bolster,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: This way the coverlet, another way the sheets:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Ay, and amid this hurly I intend

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: That all is done in reverend care of her;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And in conclusion she shall watch all night:

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And if she chance to nod I'll rail and brawl

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And with the clamour keep her still awake.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: This is a way to kill a wife with kindness;

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And thus I'll curb her mad and headstrong humour.

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: He that knows better how to tame a shrew,

scene: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now let him speak: 'tis charity to show.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Is't possible, friend Licio, that Mistress Bianca

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Doth fancy any other but Lucentio?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I tell you, sir, she bears me fair in hand.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sir, to satisfy you in what I have said,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Stand by and mark the manner of his teaching.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Now, mistress, profit you in what you read?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: What, master, read you? first resolve me that.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I read that I profess, the Art to Love.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: And may you prove, sir, master of your art!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: While you, sweet dear, prove mistress of my heart!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Quick proceeders, marry! Now, tell me, I pray,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: You that durst swear at your mistress Bianca

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Loved none in the world so well as Lucentio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: O despiteful love! unconstant womankind!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I tell thee, Licio, this is wonderful.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Mistake no more: I am not Licio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Nor a musician, as I seem to be;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: But one that scorn to live in this disguise,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For such a one as leaves a gentleman,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And makes a god of such a cullion:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Know, sir, that I am call'd Hortensio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Signior Hortensio, I have often heard

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of your entire affection to Bianca;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And since mine eyes are witness of her lightness,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I will with you, if you be so contented,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Forswear Bianca and her love for ever.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: See, how they kiss and court! Signior Lucentio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Here is my hand, and here I firmly vow

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Never to woo her no more, but do forswear her,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: As one unworthy all the former favours

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That I have fondly flatter'd her withal.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And here I take the unfeigned oath,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Never to marry with her though she would entreat:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Fie on her! see, how beastly she doth court him!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Would all the world but he had quite forsworn!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For me, that I may surely keep mine oath,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I will be married to a wealthy widow,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Ere three days pass, which hath as long loved me

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: As I have loved this proud disdainful haggard.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And so farewell, Signior Lucentio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Kindness in women, not their beauteous looks,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Shall win my love: and so I take my leave,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: In resolution as I swore before.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Mistress Bianca, bless you with such grace

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As 'longeth to a lover's blessed case!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Nay, I have ta'en you napping, gentle love,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And have forsworn you with Hortensio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Tranio, you jest: but have you both forsworn me?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Mistress, we have.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Then we are rid of Licio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I' faith, he'll have a lusty widow now,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That shall be wood and wedded in a day.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: God give him joy!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Ay, and he'll tame her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: He says so, Tranio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Faith, he is gone unto the taming-school.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: The taming-school! what, is there such a place?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Ay, mistress, and Petruchio is the master;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That teacheth tricks eleven and twenty long,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To tame a shrew and charm her chattering tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: O master, master, I have watch'd so long

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: That I am dog-weary: but at last I spied

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: An ancient angel coming down the hill,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Will serve the turn.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: What is he, Biondello?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Master, a mercatante, or a pedant,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I know not what; but format in apparel,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: In gait and countenance surely like a father.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And what of him, Tranio?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: If he be credulous and trust my tale,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I'll make him glad to seem Vincentio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And give assurance to Baptista Minola,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As if he were the right Vincentio

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Take in your love, and then let me alone.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: God save you, sir!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And you, sir! you are welcome.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Travel you far on, or are you at the farthest?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Sir, at the farthest for a week or two:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: But then up farther, and as for as Rome;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: And so to Tripoli, if God lend me life.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: What countryman, I pray?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Of Mantua.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Of Mantua, sir? marry, God forbid!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And come to Padua, careless of your life?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: My life, sir! how, I pray? for that goes hard.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis death for any one in Mantua

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To come to Padua. Know you not the cause?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Your ships are stay'd at Venice, and the duke,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: For private quarrel 'twixt your duke and him,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Hath publish'd and proclaim'd it openly:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis, marvel, but that you are but newly come,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: You might have heard it else proclaim'd about.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Alas! sir, it is worse for me than so;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: For I have bills for money by exchange

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: From Florence and must here deliver them.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
