speaker: TRANIO
line: Well, sir, to do you courtesy,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: This will I do, and this I will advise you:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: First, tell me, have you ever been at Pisa?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Ay, sir, in Pisa have I often been,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Pisa renowned for grave citizens.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Among them know you one Vincentio?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: I know him not, but I have heard of him;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: A merchant of incomparable wealth.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: He is my father, sir; and, sooth to say,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: In countenance somewhat doth resemble you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Aside  As much as an apple doth an oyster,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: and all one.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To save your life in this extremity,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: This favour will I do you for his sake;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And think it not the worst of an your fortunes

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: That you are like to Sir Vincentio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: His name and credit shall you undertake,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: And in my house you shall be friendly lodged:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Look that you take upon you as you should;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: You understand me, sir: so shall you stay

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Till you have done your business in the city:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: If this be courtesy, sir, accept of it.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: O sir, I do; and will repute you ever

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: The patron of my life and liberty.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Then go with me to make the matter good.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: This, by the way, I let you understand;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: my father is here look'd for every day,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: To pass assurance of a dower in marriage

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Twixt me and one Baptista's daughter here:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: In all these circumstances I'll instruct you:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Go with me to clothe you as becomes you.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: No, no, forsooth; I dare not for my life.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: The more my wrong, the more his spite appears:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What, did he marry me to famish me?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Beggars, that come unto my father's door,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Upon entreaty have a present aims;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: If not, elsewhere they meet with charity:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: But I, who never knew how to entreat,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Nor never needed that I should entreat,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Am starved for meat, giddy for lack of sleep,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: With oath kept waking and with brawling fed:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And that which spites me more than all these wants,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: He does it under name of perfect love;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: As who should say, if I should sleep or eat,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: 'Twere deadly sickness or else present death.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I prithee go and get me some repast;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I care not what, so it be wholesome food.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: What say you to a neat's foot?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: 'Tis passing good: I prithee let me have it.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I fear it is too choleric a meat.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: How say you to a fat tripe finely broil'd?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I like it well: good Grumio, fetch it me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I cannot tell; I fear 'tis choleric.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: What say you to a piece of beef and mustard?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A dish that I do love to feed upon.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Ay, but the mustard is too hot a little.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Why then, the beef, and let the mustard rest.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Nay then, I will not: you shall have the mustard,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Or else you get no beef of Grumio.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Then both, or one, or any thing thou wilt.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Why then, the mustard without the beef.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Go, get thee gone, thou false deluding slave,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That feed'st me with the very name of meat:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Sorrow on thee and all the pack of you,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That triumph thus upon my misery!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Go, get thee gone, I say.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How fares my Kate? What, sweeting, all amort?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Mistress, what cheer?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Faith, as cold as can be.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Pluck up thy spirits; look cheerfully upon me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here love; thou see'st how diligent I am

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To dress thy meat myself and bring it thee:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I am sure, sweet Kate, this kindness merits thanks.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, not a word? Nay, then thou lovest it not;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And all my pains is sorted to no proof.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here, take away this dish.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I pray you, let it stand.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The poorest service is repaid with thanks;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And so shall mine, before you touch the meat.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I thank you, sir.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Signior Petruchio, fie! you are to blame.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Come, mistress Kate, I'll bear you company.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Aside  Eat it up all, Hortensio, if thou lovest me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Much good do it unto thy gentle heart!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Kate, eat apace: and now, my honey love,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Will we return unto thy father's house

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And revel it as bravely as the best,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: With silken coats and caps and golden rings,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: With ruffs and cuffs and fardingales and things;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: With scarfs and fans and double change of bravery,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: With amber bracelets, beads and all this knavery.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, hast thou dined? The tailor stays thy leisure,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To deck thy body with his ruffling treasure.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, tailor, let us see these ornaments;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Lay forth the gown.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What news with you, sir?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Haberdasher
line: Here is the cap your worship did bespeak.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, this was moulded on a porringer;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A velvet dish: fie, fie! 'tis lewd and filthy:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, 'tis a cockle or a walnut-shell,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A knack, a toy, a trick, a baby's cap:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Away with it! come, let me have a bigger.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I'll have no bigger: this doth fit the time,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And gentlewomen wear such caps as these

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: When you are gentle, you shall have one too,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And not till then.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Aside  That will not be in haste.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Why, sir, I trust I may have leave to speak;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And speak I will; I am no child, no babe:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Your betters have endured me say my mind,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And if you cannot, best you stop your ears.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Or else my heart concealing it will break,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And rather than it shall, I will be free

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Even to the uttermost, as I please, in words.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, thou say'st true; it is a paltry cap,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A custard-coffin, a bauble, a silken pie:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I love thee well, in that thou likest it not.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Love me or love me not, I like the cap;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And it I will have, or I will have none.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thy gown? why, ay: come, tailor, let us see't.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O mercy, God! what masquing stuff is here?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What's this? a sleeve? 'tis like a demi-cannon:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, up and down, carved like an apple-tart?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Here's snip and nip and cut and slish and slash,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Like to a censer in a barber's shop:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, what, i' devil's name, tailor, call'st thou this?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Aside  I see she's like to have neither cap nor gown.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: You bid me make it orderly and well,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: According to the fashion and the time.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Marry, and did; but if you be remember'd,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I did not bid you mar it to the time.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go, hop me over every kennel home,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For you shall hop without my custom, sir:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll none of it: hence! make your best of it.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I never saw a better-fashion'd gown,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: More quaint, more pleasing, nor more commendable:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Belike you mean to make a puppet of me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, true; he means to make a puppet of thee.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: She says your worship means to make

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: a puppet of her.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O monstrous arrogance! Thou liest, thou thread,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: thou thimble,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thou yard, three-quarters, half-yard, quarter, nail!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thou flea, thou nit, thou winter-cricket thou!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Braved in mine own house with a skein of thread?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Away, thou rag, thou quantity, thou remnant;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Or I shall so be-mete thee with thy yard

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As thou shalt think on prating whilst thou livest!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I tell thee, I, that thou hast marr'd her gown.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Your worship is deceived; the gown is made

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Just as my master had direction:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Grumio gave order how it should be done.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I gave him no order; I gave him the stuff.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: But how did you desire it should be made?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Marry, sir, with needle and thread.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: But did you not request to have it cut?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Thou hast faced many things.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: I have.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Face not me: thou hast braved many men; brave not

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: me; I will neither be faced nor braved. I say unto

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: thee, I bid thy master cut out the gown; but I did

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: not bid him cut it to pieces: ergo, thou liest.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Why, here is the note of the fashion to testify

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Read it.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: The note lies in's throat, if he say I said so.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Reads  'Imprimis, a loose-bodied gown:'

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Master, if ever I said loose-bodied gown, sew me in

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: the skirts of it, and beat me to death with a bottom

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: of brown thread: I said a gown.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Proceed.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Reads  'With a small compassed cape:'

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I confess the cape.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Reads  'With a trunk sleeve:'

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I confess two sleeves.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: Reads  'The sleeves curiously cut.'

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Ay, there's the villany.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Error i' the bill, sir; error i' the bill.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I commanded the sleeves should be cut out and

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: sewed up again; and that I'll prove upon thee,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: though thy little finger be armed in a thimble.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: This is true that I say: an I had thee

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: Tailor
line: in place where, thou shouldst know it.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: I am for thee straight: take thou the

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: bill, give me thy mete-yard, and spare not me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: God-a-mercy, Grumio! then he shall have no odds.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Well, sir, in brief, the gown is not for me.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: You are i' the right, sir: 'tis for my mistress.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go, take it up unto thy master's use.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Villain, not for thy life: take up my mistress'

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: gown for thy master's use!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, sir, what's your conceit in that?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O, sir, the conceit is deeper than you think for:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: Take up my mistress' gown to his master's use!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: GRUMIO
line: O, fie, fie, fie!

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Aside  Hortensio, say thou wilt see the tailor paid.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go take it hence; be gone, and say no more.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Tailor, I'll pay thee for thy gown tomorrow:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Take no unkindness of his hasty words:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Away! I say; commend me to thy master.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Well, come, my Kate; we will unto your father's

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Even in these honest mean habiliments:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Our purses shall be proud, our garments poor;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For 'tis the mind that makes the body rich;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And as the sun breaks through the darkest clouds,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: So honour peereth in the meanest habit.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What is the jay more precious than the lark,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Because his fathers are more beautiful?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Or is the adder better than the eel,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Because his painted skin contents the eye?

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, no, good Kate; neither art thou the worse

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For this poor furniture and mean array.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: if thou account'st it shame. lay it on me;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And therefore frolic: we will hence forthwith,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To feast and sport us at thy father's house.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go, call my men, and let us straight to him;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And bring our horses unto Long-lane end;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: There will we mount, and thither walk on foot

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Let's see; I think 'tis now some seven o'clock,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And well we may come there by dinner-time.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I dare assure you, sir, 'tis almost two;

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And 'twill be supper-time ere you come there.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It shall be seven ere I go to horse:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Look, what I speak, or do, or think to do,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You are still crossing it. Sirs, let't alone:

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I will not go to-day; and ere I do,

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It shall be what o'clock I say it is.

scene: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Aside  Why, so this gallant will command the sun.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Sir, this is the house: please it you that I call?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Ay, what else? and but I be deceived

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Signior Baptista may remember me,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Near twenty years ago, in Genoa,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Where we were lodgers at the Pegasus.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis well; and hold your own, in any case,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: With such austerity as 'longeth to a father.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: I warrant you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: But, sir, here comes your boy;

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: 'Twere good he were school'd.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Fear you not him. Sirrah Biondello,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Now do your duty throughly, I advise you:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Imagine 'twere the right Vincentio.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Tut, fear not me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: But hast thou done thy errand to Baptista?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I told him that your father was at Venice,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: And that you look'd for him this day in Padua.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Thou'rt a tall fellow: hold thee that to drink.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Here comes Baptista: set your countenance, sir.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Signior Baptista, you are happily met.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Sir, this is the gentleman I told you of:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I pray you stand good father to me now,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Give me Bianca for my patrimony.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Soft son!

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Sir, by your leave: having come to Padua

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: To gather in some debts, my son Lucentio

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Made me acquainted with a weighty cause

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Of love between your daughter and himself:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: And, for the good report I hear of you

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: And for the love he beareth to your daughter

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: And she to him, to stay him not too long,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: I am content, in a good father's care,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: To have him match'd; and if you please to like

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: No worse than I, upon some agreement

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Me shall you find ready and willing

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: With one consent to have her so bestow'd;

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: For curious I cannot be with you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Signior Baptista, of whom I hear so well.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Sir, pardon me in what I have to say:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Your plainness and your shortness please me well.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Right true it is, your son Lucentio here

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Doth love my daughter and she loveth him,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Or both dissemble deeply their affections:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And therefore, if you say no more than this,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: That like a father you will deal with him

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And pass my daughter a sufficient dower,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: The match is made, and all is done:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Your son shall have my daughter with consent.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I thank you, sir. Where then do you know best

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: We be affied and such assurance ta'en

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: As shall with either part's agreement stand?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Not in my house, Lucentio; for, you know,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Pitchers have ears, and I have many servants:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Besides, old Gremio is hearkening still;

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And happily we might be interrupted.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Then at my lodging, an it like you:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: There doth my father lie; and there, this night,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: We'll pass the business privately and well.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Send for your daughter by your servant here:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: My boy shall fetch the scrivener presently.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: The worst is this, that, at so slender warning,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: You are like to have a thin and slender pittance.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: It likes me well. Biondello, hie you home,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And bid Bianca make her ready straight;

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And, if you will, tell what hath happened,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Lucentio's father is arrived in Padua,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And how she's like to be Lucentio's wife.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I pray the gods she may with all my heart!

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Dally not with the gods, but get thee gone.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Signior Baptista, shall I lead the way?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Welcome! one mess is like to be your cheer:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Come, sir; we will better it in Pisa.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I follow you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Cambio!

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: What sayest thou, Biondello?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: You saw my master wink and laugh upon you?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Biondello, what of that?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Faith, nothing; but has left me here behind, to

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: expound the meaning or moral of his signs and tokens.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I pray thee, moralize them.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Then thus. Baptista is safe, talking with the

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: deceiving father of a deceitful son.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And what of him?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: His daughter is to be brought by you to the supper.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And then?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: The old priest of Saint Luke's church is at your

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: command at all hours.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And what of all this?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I cannot tell; expect they are busied about a

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: counterfeit assurance: take you assurance of her,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: 'cum privilegio ad imprimendum solum:' to the

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: church; take the priest, clerk, and some sufficient

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: honest witnesses: If this be not that you look for,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I have no more to say, But bid Bianca farewell for

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: ever and a day.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Hearest thou, Biondello?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I cannot tarry: I knew a wench married in an

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: afternoon as she went to the garden for parsley to

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: stuff a rabbit; and so may you, sir: and so, adieu,

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: sir. My master hath appointed me to go to Saint

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Luke's, to bid the priest be ready to come against

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: you come with your appendix.

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I may, and will, if she be so contented:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: She will be pleased; then wherefore should I doubt?

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Hap what hap may, I'll roundly go about her:

scene: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: It shall go hard if Cambio go without her.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come on, i' God's name; once more toward our father's.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Good Lord, how bright and goodly shines the moon!

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: The moon! the sun: it is not moonlight now.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I say it is the moon that shines so bright.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I know it is the sun that shines so bright.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, by my mother's son, and that's myself,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: It shall be moon, or star, or what I list,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Or ere I journey to your father's house.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go on, and fetch our horses back again.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Evermore cross'd and cross'd; nothing but cross'd!

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Say as he says, or we shall never go.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Forward, I pray, since we have come so far,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And be it moon, or sun, or what you please:

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: An if you please to call it a rush-candle,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Henceforth I vow it shall be so for me.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I say it is the moon.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I know it is the moon.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, then you lie: it is the blessed sun.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Then, God be bless'd, it is the blessed sun:

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: But sun it is not, when you say it is not;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And the moon changes even as your mind.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What you will have it named, even that it is;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And so it shall be so for Katharina.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Petruchio, go thy ways; the field is won.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Well, forward, forward! thus the bowl should run,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And not unluckily against the bias.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But, soft! company is coming here.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Good morrow, gentle mistress: where away?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Tell me, sweet Kate, and tell me truly too,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Hast thou beheld a fresher gentlewoman?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Such war of white and red within her cheeks!

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What stars do spangle heaven with such beauty,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As those two eyes become that heavenly face?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Fair lovely maid, once more good day to thee.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sweet Kate, embrace her for her beauty's sake.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: A' will make the man mad, to make a woman of him.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Young budding virgin, fair and fresh and sweet,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Whither away, or where is thy abode?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Happy the parents of so fair a child;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Happier the man, whom favourable stars

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Allot thee for his lovely bed-fellow!

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, how now, Kate! I hope thou art not mad:

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: This is a man, old, wrinkled, faded, wither'd,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And not a maiden, as thou say'st he is.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Pardon, old father, my mistaking eyes,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That have been so bedazzled with the sun

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That everything I look on seemeth green:

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Now I perceive thou art a reverend father;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Pardon, I pray thee, for my mad mistaking.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Do, good old grandsire; and withal make known

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Which way thou travellest: if along with us,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: We shall be joyful of thy company.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Fair sir, and you my merry mistress,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: That with your strange encounter much amazed me,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: My name is call'd Vincentio; my dwelling Pisa;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: And bound I am to Padua; there to visit

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: A son of mine, which long I have not seen.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What is his name?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Lucentio, gentle sir.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Happily we met; the happier for thy son.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And now by law, as well as reverend age,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I may entitle thee my loving father:

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The sister to my wife, this gentlewoman,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thy son by this hath married. Wonder not,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nor be grieved: she is of good esteem,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her dowery wealthy, and of worthy birth;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Beside, so qualified as may beseem

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The spouse of any noble gentleman.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Let me embrace with old Vincentio,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And wander we to see thy honest son,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Who will of thy arrival be full joyous.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: But is it true? or else is it your pleasure,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Like pleasant travellers, to break a jest

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Upon the company you overtake?

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I do assure thee, father, so it is.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, go along, and see the truth hereof;

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: For our first merriment hath made thee jealous.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Well, Petruchio, this has put me in heart.

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Have to my widow! and if she be froward,

scene: SCENE V.  A public road.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Then hast thou taught Hortensio to be untoward.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Softly and swiftly, sir; for the priest is ready.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I fly, Biondello: but they may chance to need thee

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: at home; therefore leave us.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Nay, faith, I'll see the church o' your back; and

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: then come back to my master's as soon as I can.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: I marvel Cambio comes not all this while.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sir, here's the door, this is Lucentio's house:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: My father's bears more toward the market-place;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Thither must I, and here I leave you, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: You shall not choose but drink before you go:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: I think I shall command your welcome here,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: And, by all likelihood, some cheer is toward.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: They're busy within; you were best knock louder.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: What's he that knocks as he would beat down the gate?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Is Signior Lucentio within, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: He's within, sir, but not to be spoken withal.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: What if a man bring him a hundred pound or two, to

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: make merry withal?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Keep your hundred pounds to yourself: he shall

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: need none, so long as I live.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, I told you your son was well beloved in Padua.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Do you hear, sir? To leave frivolous circumstances,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I pray you, tell Signior Lucentio that his father is

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: come from Pisa, and is here at the door to speak with him.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Thou liest: his father is come from Padua and here

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: looking out at the window.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Art thou his father?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Ay, sir; so his mother says, if I may believe her.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To VINCENTIO  Why, how now, gentleman! why, this

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: is flat knavery, to take upon you another man's name.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Lay hands on the villain: I believe a' means to

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: cozen somebody in this city under my countenance.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I have seen them in the church together: God send

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: 'em good shipping! But who is here? mine old

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: master Vincentio! now we are undone and brought to nothing.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Seeing BIONDELLO

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Come hither, crack-hemp.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Hope I may choose, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Come hither, you rogue. What, have you forgot me?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Forgot you! no, sir: I could not forget you, for I

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: never saw you before in all my life.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: What, you notorious villain, didst thou never see

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: thy master's father, Vincentio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: What, my old worshipful old master? yes, marry, sir:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: see where he looks out of the window.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Is't so, indeed.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Help, help, help! here's a madman will murder me.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Help, son! help, Signior Baptista!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Prithee, Kate, let's stand aside and see the end of

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: this controversy.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Sir, what are you that offer to beat my servant?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: What am I, sir! nay, what are you, sir? O immortal

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: gods! O fine villain! A silken doublet! a velvet

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: hose! a scarlet cloak! and a copatain hat! O, I

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: am undone! I am undone! while I play the good

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: husband at home, my son and my servant spend all at

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: the university.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: How now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: What, is the man lunatic?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Sir, you seem a sober ancient gentleman by your

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: habit, but your words show you a madman. Why, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: what 'cerns it you if I wear pearl and gold? I

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: thank my good father, I am able to maintain it.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Thy father! O villain! he is a sailmaker in Bergamo.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir. Pray, what do

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: you think is his name?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: His name! as if I knew not his name: I have brought

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: him up ever since he was three years old, and his

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: name is Tranio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Away, away, mad ass! his name is Lucentio and he is

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: mine only son, and heir to the lands of me, Signior Vincentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Lucentio! O, he hath murdered his master! Lay hold

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: on him, I charge you, in the duke's name. O, my

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: son, my son! Tell me, thou villain, where is my son Lucentio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Call forth an officer.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Carry this mad knave to the gaol. Father Baptista,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: I charge you see that he be forthcoming.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Carry me to the gaol!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Stay, officer: he shall not go to prison.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Talk not, Signior Gremio: I say he shall go to prison.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Take heed, Signior Baptista, lest you be

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: cony-catched in this business: I dare swear this

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: is the right Vincentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Pedant
line: Swear, if thou darest.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Nay, I dare not swear it.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Then thou wert best say that I am not Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Away with the dotard! to the gaol with him!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Thus strangers may be hailed and abused: O

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: monstrous villain!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: O! we are spoiled and--yonder he is: deny him,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: forswear him, or else we are all undone.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Kneeling  Pardon, sweet father.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Lives my sweet son?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Pardon, dear father.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: How hast thou offended?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Where is Lucentio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Here's Lucentio,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Right son to the right Vincentio;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: That have by marriage made thy daughter mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: While counterfeit supposes bleared thine eyne.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Here's packing, with a witness to deceive us all!

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Where is that damned villain Tranio,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: That faced and braved me in this matter so?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Why, tell me, is not this my Cambio?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Cambio is changed into Lucentio.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Love wrought these miracles. Bianca's love

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Made me exchange my state with Tranio,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: While he did bear my countenance in the town;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And happily I have arrived at the last

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Unto the wished haven of my bliss.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: What Tranio did, myself enforced him to;

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Then pardon him, sweet father, for my sake.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: I'll slit the villain's nose, that would have sent

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: me to the gaol.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: But do you hear, sir? have you married my daughter

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: without asking my good will?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Fear not, Baptista; we will content you, go to: but

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: I will in, to be revenged for this villany.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: And I, to sound the depth of this knavery.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Look not pale, Bianca; thy father will not frown.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: My cake is dough; but I'll in among the rest,

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Out of hope of all, but my share of the feast.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Husband, let's follow, to see the end of this ado.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: First kiss me, Kate, and we will.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What, in the midst of the street?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What, art thou ashamed of me?

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: No, sir, God forbid; but ashamed to kiss.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, then let's home again. Come, sirrah, let's away.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Nay, I will give thee a kiss: now pray thee, love, stay.

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Is not this well? Come, my sweet Kate:

scene: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Better once than never, for never too late.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: At last, though long, our jarring notes agree:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And time it is, when raging war is done,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: To smile at scapes and perils overblown.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: My fair Bianca, bid my father welcome,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: While I with self-same kindness welcome thine.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Brother Petruchio, sister Katharina,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: And thou, Hortensio, with thy loving widow,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Feast with the best, and welcome to my house:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: My banquet is to close our stomachs up,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: After our great good cheer. Pray you, sit down;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: For now we sit to chat as well as eat.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nothing but sit and sit, and eat and eat!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Padua affords this kindness, son Petruchio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Padua affords nothing but what is kind.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: For both our sakes, I would that word were true.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Now, for my life, Hortensio fears his widow.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Then never trust me, if I be afeard.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I mean, Hortensio is afeard of you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Roundly replied.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Mistress, how mean you that?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Thus I conceive by him.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Conceives by me! How likes Hortensio that?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: My widow says, thus she conceives her tale.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Very well mended. Kiss him for that, good widow.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: 'He that is giddy thinks the world turns round:'

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I pray you, tell me what you meant by that.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Your husband, being troubled with a shrew,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Measures my husband's sorrow by his woe:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: And now you know my meaning,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A very mean meaning.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Right, I mean you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And I am mean indeed, respecting you.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To her, Kate!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To her, widow!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A hundred marks, my Kate does put her down.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: That's my office.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Spoke like an officer; ha' to thee, lad!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: How likes Gremio these quick-witted folks?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Believe me, sir, they butt together well.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Head, and butt! an hasty-witted body

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Would say your head and butt were head and horn.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: Ay, mistress bride, hath that awaken'd you?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Ay, but not frighted me; therefore I'll sleep again.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, that you shall not: since you have begun,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Have at you for a bitter jest or two!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Am I your bird? I mean to shift my bush;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: And then pursue me as you draw your bow.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: You are welcome all.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: She hath prevented me. Here, Signior Tranio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: This bird you aim'd at, though you hit her not;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Therefore a health to all that shot and miss'd.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: O, sir, Lucentio slipp'd me like his greyhound,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: Which runs himself and catches for his master.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A good swift simile, but something currish.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis well, sir, that you hunted for yourself:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: TRANIO
line: 'Tis thought your deer does hold you at a bay.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: O ho, Petruchio! Tranio hits you now.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I thank thee for that gird, good Tranio.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Confess, confess, hath he not hit you here?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A' has a little gall'd me, I confess;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, as the jest did glance away from me,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Tis ten to one it maim'd you two outright.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now, in good sadness, son Petruchio,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: I think thou hast the veriest shrew of all.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Well, I say no: and therefore for assurance

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Let's each one send unto his wife;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And he whose wife is most obedient

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: To come at first when he doth send for her,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Shall win the wager which we will propose.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Content. What is the wager?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Twenty crowns.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Twenty crowns!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I'll venture so much of my hawk or hound,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: But twenty times so much upon my wife.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: A hundred then.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Content.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: A match! 'tis done.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Who shall begin?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: That will I.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Go, Biondello, bid your mistress come to me.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: I go.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Son, I'll be your half, Bianca comes.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I'll have no halves; I'll bear it all myself.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: How now! what news?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: Sir, my mistress sends you word

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: That she is busy and she cannot come.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: How! she is busy and she cannot come!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Is that an answer?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Ay, and a kind one too:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: GREMIO
line: Pray God, sir, your wife send you not a worse.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I hope better.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Sirrah Biondello, go and entreat my wife

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: To come to me forthwith.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: O, ho! entreat her!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, then she must needs come.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I am afraid, sir,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Do what you can, yours will not be entreated.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Now, where's my wife?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: She says you have some goodly jest in hand:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIONDELLO
line: She will not come: she bids you come to her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Worse and worse; she will not come! O vile,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Intolerable, not to be endured!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Sirrah Grumio, go to your mistress;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Say, I command her to come to me.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: I know her answer.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: She will not.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: The fouler fortune mine, and there an end.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now, by my holidame, here comes Katharina!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What is your will, sir, that you send for me?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Where is your sister, and Hortensio's wife?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: They sit conferring by the parlor fire.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Go fetch them hither: if they deny to come.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Swinge me them soundly forth unto their husbands:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Away, I say, and bring them hither straight.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Here is a wonder, if you talk of a wonder.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: And so it is: I wonder what it bodes.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Marry, peace it bodes, and love and quiet life,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And awful rule and right supremacy;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, to be short, what not, that's sweet and happy?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Now, fair befal thee, good Petruchio!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: The wager thou hast won; and I will add

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Unto their losses twenty thousand crowns;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: Another dowry to another daughter,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BAPTISTA
line: For she is changed, as she had never been.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Nay, I will win my wager better yet

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And show more sign of her obedience,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Her new-built virtue and obedience.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: See where she comes and brings your froward wives

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: As prisoners to her womanly persuasion.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Katharina, that cap of yours becomes you not:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Off with that bauble, throw it under-foot.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Lord, let me never have a cause to sigh,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Till I be brought to such a silly pass!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: Fie! what a foolish duty call you this?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: I would your duty were as foolish too:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: The wisdom of your duty, fair Bianca,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Hath cost me an hundred crowns since supper-time.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: BIANCA
line: The more fool you, for laying on my duty.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Katharina, I charge thee, tell these headstrong women

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: What duty they do owe their lords and husbands.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: Come, come, you're mocking: we will have no telling.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come on, I say; and first begin with her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: Widow
line: She shall not.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: I say she shall: and first begin with her.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Fie, fie! unknit that threatening unkind brow,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And dart not scornful glances from those eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To wound thy lord, thy king, thy governor:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: It blots thy beauty as frosts do bite the meads,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Confounds thy fame as whirlwinds shake fair buds,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And in no sense is meet or amiable.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: A woman moved is like a fountain troubled,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Muddy, ill-seeming, thick, bereft of beauty;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And while it is so, none so dry or thirsty

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Will deign to sip or touch one drop of it.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Thy husband is thy lord, thy life, thy keeper,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Thy head, thy sovereign; one that cares for thee,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And for thy maintenance commits his body

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To painful labour both by sea and land,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To watch the night in storms, the day in cold,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Whilst thou liest warm at home, secure and safe;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And craves no other tribute at thy hands

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: But love, fair looks and true obedience;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Too little payment for so great a debt.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Such duty as the subject owes the prince

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Even such a woman oweth to her husband;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And when she is froward, peevish, sullen, sour,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And not obedient to his honest will,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: What is she but a foul contending rebel

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And graceless traitor to her loving lord?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: I am ashamed that women are so simple

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To offer war where they should kneel for peace;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Or seek for rule, supremacy and sway,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: When they are bound to serve, love and obey.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Why are our bodies soft and weak and smooth,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Unapt to toil and trouble in the world,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: But that our soft conditions and our hearts

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Should well agree with our external parts?

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Come, come, you froward and unable worms!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: My mind hath been as big as one of yours,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: My heart as great, my reason haply more,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: To bandy word for word and frown for frown;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: But now I see our lances are but straws,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Our strength as weak, our weakness past compare,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: That seeming to be most which we indeed least are.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: Then vail your stomachs, for it is no boot,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: And place your hands below your husband's foot:

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: In token of which duty, if he please,

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: KATHARINA
line: My hand is ready; may it do him ease.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Why, there's a wench! Come on, and kiss me, Kate.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: Well, go thy ways, old lad; for thou shalt ha't.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: VINCENTIO
line: 'Tis a good hearing when children are toward.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: But a harsh hearing when women are froward.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: Come, Kate, we'll to bed.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: We three are married, but you two are sped.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: 'Twas I won the wager, though you hit the white;

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: PETRUCHIO
line: And, being a winner, God give you good night!

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: HORTENSIO
line: Now, go thy ways; thou hast tamed a curst shrew.

scene: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
speaker: LUCENTIO
line: 'Tis a wonder, by your leave, she will be tamed so.
